issue.title: [CF 734] Load profile from command line or macro
issue.body:
Hi,

I'd like to ask for a feature to load a saved profile from command line (script) or macro.
e.g.: /tmw -p "MyAwseomeProfile"

Or is that already possible?

Many greetings
-Wytheron-


> Posted by CurseForge user wytheron | Imported from CurseForge issue #734 | Raw

comments.body:
What would be the purpose of a feature like this?

If you intend to switch between profiles for certain specs, then there is no need for this. TellMeWhen already provides options that allow each group to be shown or hidden based on your current spec.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Might be useful when you want to switch between Questing/Raiding/Battleground/Arena/Other profiles using a button which is dropped onto an action bar or even keybound.


> Posted by CurseForge user CuteBunny

Hi Cybeloras,

yes, I know this feature you are talking about, but I find it kinda cramps up the icons/interface in edit mode and it is harder to keep the overall overview. I find it much better to have 2 profiles (one resto, one balance) because I can create a layout for each and they are more cleaned up because my UI is very different for healing vs. DPSing.

CuteBunny got it right (this is not intended to imply that you got it totally wrong though). I'd like to have a button which has a macro behind it to: 1) Change spec (this also automatically switches Vuhdo and ELVUI profiles as they support spec specific profiles). 2) Change gear set. 3) Change TMW profile.

The profile system is already part of TMW (because ACE lib comes with that feature, I think) and I already had a somewhat hackish macro/script that used the ACE API to load a profile, but that was a really long line and using something like that in macros is a little like an overkill (ace stub static database profile something) and I lost that macro after my HDD crashed. :(

Don't worry, I'll keep on using this great addon, even in case my feature request/suggestion will not make it into a future version. ;P Keep up that great work you (as a team?) are doing!!!

Thank you for your time and patience -Wytheron-


> Posted by CurseForge user wytheron

I will consider it, but I just want to point out that the group spec options also affect groups while in config mode, so if you say that it cramps up your UI while in config mode, it makes me think that you are using group conditions instead of the group settings.

Again, I'm not ruling this feature out, but I just wanted to note this.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Added in r698.

Usage: (case sensitive, profile names with spaces must be quoted).

/tmw profile "Cybeloras - Aerie Peak"


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

GREAT!! Thank you soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo much!!!! :)


> Posted by CurseForge user wytheron
